Bioversity International encourages the use of these datasets, but emphasizes that many of them contain "raw data" files. When applicable, all information which would allow individuals to be identified has been deleted from the files. For some of the datasets, the user will need to take care in handling missing observations, outlier values and violations of logical consistency.

fields.value: Sequences of NAC genes of M. acuminata, O.sativa, V. vinifera and A. thaliana

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Fasta file containing the 407 translated sequences of NAC genes of M.acuminata, O. sativa, V. vinifera and A. thaliana analysed in this study. 
The sequences of NAC protein-coding genes were extracted from gene family database GreenPhylDB (Rouard et al. 2011) based on the presence of the NAM (No apical meristem) InterPro domain.  then, an expert revision of the gene structure of this family was conducted.

publicationCitation.value: Cenci, A.; Guignon, V.; Roux, N.; Rouard, M.(2014) Genomic analysis of NAC transcription factors in banana (Musa acuminata) and definition of NAC orthologous groups for monocots and dicots. Plant Molecular Biology 85(1-2) : p. 63-80 ISSN:0167-4412

fields.value:
Other datasets are available as supplementary material of the journal article. Some data were also deposited in dedicated repositories: 
Treebase (http://purl.org/phylo/treebase/phylows/study/TB2:S14688 ) and 
greenphyl (http://www.greenphyl.org/cgi-bin/custom_family.cgi?p=id&custom_family_id=104064)

value: CRP 3.4: CGIAR Research Program on Roots, Tubers and Bananas
